meeting_annotations.speaker: Timothy W Lyons

meeting_annotations.speaker: Timothy W Lyons
meeting_annotations.transcript: Um, so I've often asked about the feasibility of ever doing isotopic measurements of methane in an atmosphere around an exoplanet and people usually laughed, but it's uh I think it's not physically impossible.

Um, it turns out that it like chemical scales even in certain chemical reactions, you can basically play games with entropy where you take small kind of ratcheted steps to kind of gain negative entropy. Um, and there's some really interesting thermodynamics there that is obviously relevant to chemistry. So there is kind of an interesting connection from large scales to small this idea of essentially looking at the statistical mechanics or the thermodynamics of the system and asking questions about it.
